results.title: Love me tender
results.creator_credit: Robert D Webb, David Weisbart and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Love Me Tender is most noteable for being Elvis Presley’s cinematic debut and the launching pad for one of his most recognisable hits Love Me Tender. The story of the Reno brothers starts at the end of the Civil War. Presley is Clint Reno a young farmer trying to keep the family farm running after the family are told that the oldest brother, Vance Reno has been killed in battle. Believing his brother is dead, Clint and Vance’s sweetheart Kathy marry. However, Vance returns with the intention of marrying Kathy. Clint receives reassurance from Vance that he bears no resentment towards the pair. However, the trios relationships with one another are soon tested when Vance is arrested and taken away for trial. This one event leads the trio to a climatic encounter that ends tragicly for all. While in the majority of the film Presley gets to display his acting ability the story is broken up with Presley singing and dancing.

results.title: Love nest
results.creator_credit: Joseph Newman, Jules Buck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: When serviceman Jim Scott (William Lundigan) returns home after 2 1/2 years in the Army he finds his wife, Connie (June Haver), has bought a run down apartment block and assumed the role of landlady at 337 Grammercy Place. Eager to resume his writing, he soon learns that the landlord is always home, and with a suspected Casanova swindler as a tenant, and a jealous wife following the arrival of Jim’s beautiful Army buddy WAC Bobby (Marilyn Monroe), it will take something exceptional to get his writing off the ground and save the decrepit building from being condemned. Cast also includes Frank Fay, Leatrice Joy and Jack Parr. Based on the novel by Scott Corbett. Includes the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Kika
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar, Agustin Almodovar, Esther Garcia and Ciby
results.brief_description: An intriguing web of desire, deceit and death are expertly woven together in this effervescent satire by the unrepentantly twisted director Pedro Almodovar. The madness begins with motormouth make-up artist Kika (Veronique Forque) being summoned to the home of ex-pat American writer Nicholas (Peter Coyote) to make over the corpse of his step-son, Ramon (Alex Casanovas). During her ministrations, Ramon awakens from a cataleptic trance, and the pair fall in love. Complicating their bizarre relationship further are Kika’s sporadic involvement with Nicholas, the lustful adoration of her maid, Juana (Rossy de Palma), and Ramon’s demented ex-girlfriend, Andrea Scarface (Victoria Abril), the host of the voyeuristic reality television show, `Today’s Worst’. Committed to turning private lives inside out for a scoop, Andrea zips around Madrid on a motorcycle with a camera strapped to her crash helmet. Things truly take a turn for the outrageous when Juana’s psychotic ex-porn star brother, Pablo, appears on the scene after breaking out of jail, with Andrea hot on his heels. An explicit but entertaining film filled with fabulous imagery and dazzling costumes from famous fashion designers Jean Paul Gaultier and Gianni Versace. Veronique Forque won a Goya Award for Best Lead Actress for her portrayal of Kika. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: A Chinese ghost story II = Sinnui yauman II [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ching Siu-tung, Tsui Hark and Golden Princess Film Production Ltd
results.brief_description: The story has its origins in a Chinese short story by Pu Song-ling which was also the basis of Li Hanxiang’s 1958 film, ‘The Enchanted Shadow’. The internationally successful trio of ‘Chinese Ghost Story’ films integrates ideas and images from Western movies and John Carpenter films with the classical Chinese story. Here, the plot takes up where part 1 leaves off, with Leslie Cheung as a wandering scholar turning his back on the gates of hell, only to find himself fending off attacks from a decomposing giant. He is drawn into guerilla action to free an unjustly imprisoned official and finds himself torn between the love of the official’s two daughters. The film is a mixture of high style, low comedy, steamy romantic interludes, spectacular special effects and rapid-fire editing. Cast also includes Wang Zu Zian (Wang Tsu-hsien) and Wu Ma (Wo Ma). In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Bullet in the head
results.creator_credit: John Woo, Golden Princess Film Production Ltd and John Woo Film Productions
results.brief_description: Set during the Vietnam war and focusing on the lives of three life-long friends, this film has been described as an ‘Eastern Deer Hunter’. In 1967 the three young men, fugitives from the Hong Kong police, set up a black-market operation in war-torn Saigon. Almost immediately after their arrival they run into trouble and forced to flee Saigon when they are captured by the Vietcong and taken to a prisoner-of-war camp. Thrown together in extreme conditions, they turn on each other as lust, betrayal and greed threaten to shatter their closeness. Made in the year following the Tiannamen Square Massacre, the film focuses on the strain that relationships undergo in times of strife, and the brutality of the war in Vietnam. Named by Woo as his personal favorite, it features his trademark combination of ballistic gun action and pathos around the theme of homosocial bonding. Cast includes Tony Leung, Jacky Cheung and Simon Yam. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Bride with white hair
results.brief_description: Directed with exuberant energy by Ronnie Yu (“Bride of Chucky”), “The Bride with white hair” is a fine example of the type of genre bending movies that Hong Kong cinema is most famous for. Part Romeo and Juliet and part martial arts fantasy adventure, the film takes place in a mythic, medieval China and stars Hong Kong superstars Brigitte Lin and Leslie Cheung as members of opposing clans who fall in love and get caught in the middle of a violent feud. The film’s shamelessly romantic mood is set from the opening scene which has Cho Yi Hang (Leslie Cheung), a Wu Tang Clan sect disciple, forlornly guarding a single white rose believed to have mystical powers, while mourning the absence of his true love, Lian Nichang (Brigitte Lin), the white haired one of the title. The film then goes back ten years to tell their epic story, complete with evil siamese twins and plenty of hair extension fighting. Cast includes Francis Ng, Elaine Lu. Based on the novel by Leung Yu-Sang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: My father is a hero
results.creator_credit: Corey Yuen, Tiffany Chin, Wong Jing and Jing Tung Productions
results.brief_description: An undercover policeman from Mainland China (Jet Li) is assigned the dangerous task of infiltrating a criminal organisation in Hong Kong. Years of undercover work and keeping his occupation concealed from his disease-stricken wife and young son have shattered his family life. When a female Hong Kong detective finds out about his double identity, she endeavors to bring his son to Hong Kong, but in doing so blows the policeman’s cover, leaving him fighting for both his own and his son’s lives. While Jet Li was already famous for his roles in historical martial arts films such as the ‘Once Upon a Time’ and ‘Fong Sai Yuk’ series, this was his first part in a contemporary action film. This film established his reputation in this genre and further enhanced his working relationship with action director master Corey Yuen-Kwai. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Prison on fire
results.creator_credit: Ringo Lam, Catherine Chang, Karl Maka and Cinema City Film Production
results.brief_description: After accidentally committing a murder, a young advertising executive is sentenced to three years in prison. His clean looks and straight-forward honesty with the prison staff make him a target for the various triad factions at work in the institution, until he forms an alliance with an older prisoner who knows the ins and outs of the system. Less an action film than a drama in the prison film genre, “Prison on fire” explores themes of honour, loyalty and friendship, capturing the bleakness and despair of prison life through the drab, claustrophobic colour scheme and absence of music. Lam’s portrayal of a Chinese prison eschews the usual prison film cliches, focusing instead on how the prison environment brings out the worst in people. Cast includes Chow Yun-Fat, Tony Leung and Roy Cheung. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Full alert
results.creator_credit: Ringo Lam, Li Kuo-Hsing, Brilliant Idea Group and Young Filmmakers
results.brief_description: After the failure of his first Hollywood film, ‘Maximum Risk’, Lam returned to Hong Kong to shoot this $13 million action film. A claustrophobic police thriller set just after the handover of Hong Kong to China, ‘Full Alert’ revives the ‘film bleu’ tradition of Hong Kong cop and gangster films, its belligerent energy recalling the sense of anarchy in Hong Kong films of the eighties. Inspector Pao is a grizzled, jaded veteran cop who has seen it all in his years with the Hong Kong police. After a vicious murderer escapes to Taiwan, Pau vows to track him down. To him he represents a new kind of criminal— smart, canny, ambitious and vicious— a man who will stop at nothing to get what he wants. As in Michael Mann’s ‘Heat’ (1996) to which ‘Full Alert’ has been compared, the cop and the robber are set up as a pair of compelling twins/opposites driven to battle each other. They increasingly come to resemble each other in motive and character as the film progresses. Cast includes Lau Ching-Wan and Francis Ng. In Cantonese with English and Mandarin subtitles.
